{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3324980,"name":"T3 Admin","username":"t37312","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/t37312/{size}/181319_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T22:04:39.113Z","cooked":"

We just got our camera to recognize April Tags using the Photonvision software and we would like to figure out how to center our swerve in front of the amp but I have no clue where to even start looking for that. Does anyone know any good resources with java code for what I’m trying to accomplish?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-03-05T22:04:39.113Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":81,"reads":95,"readers_count":94,"score":424.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":457437,"topic_slug":"help-needed-how-to-code-centering-a-swerve-drive-in-front-of-apriltags-java","display_username":"T3 Admin","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53194,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/help-needed-how-to-code-centering-a-swerve-drive-in-front-of-apriltags-java/457437/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3325198,"name":"Scarlett Saam","username":"Scarlett_4131","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/scarlett_4131/{size}/218378_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T01:16:08.124Z","cooked":"

Hi! Please feel free to check out our various “Go to pose” commands in our 2023 and 2024 repositories in our github. I hope it is helpful to you.

GitHub

Iron Patriots

FRC Team 4131 from Liberty High School. Iron Patriots has 30 repositories available. Follow their code on GitHub.

I would first put vision into your pose estimation pipeline. From there you just run a PID controller for desired omega (rotational velocity) and send that off to your swerve. Here is our implementation: https://github.com/Vector8177/2024-Robot/blob/main/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/swerve/controllers/AutoAlignController.java .

This is based off of 6328 (Mechanical Advantage)‘s code, and has worked really well for us. If you wanted to make it reach the set pose as well, you simply make another PID controller that uses a Pose2d as the measurement. Every frame, you then calculate a Field Relative Chassis speeds object based the current pose and target pose (this will be the output of the PID controller), then you use your kinematics object to convert that to chassis speeds, and then you put that in your runVelocity method (should be in the Swerve subsystem file). I would probably make a state variable in RobotContainer and then feed that in as a supplier to swerve so you can have a switch case in runVelocity that only implements this logic if the current mode is autoalign.
